user_question: How does the sleep cycle of a dolphin differ from that of a human?
final_answer: Dolphins have a unique sleep cycle where they sleep with one hemisphere of their brain at a time, allowing them to remain partially conscious to breathe and be aware of their surroundings. Humans, on the other hand, experience a full sleep cycle with both hemispheres of the brain resting simultaneously.
